title: inefficiency of launcher
body:
Hello, since i have reinstall my computer, i had to reinstall lol, but two things i have noticed that i think are wrong.
1) pando media booster, during the install it installed pando then during the update you removed it? why is it still bundled with the installer when you removed so long ago? 
2)6GB of temp files, after the first update, i noticed that the lol folder is way bigger then i remember it was, so i checked it out and found that there is 6GB in temp files and the game is only 3GB? why the excessive amount of temporary files and why did not not get cleaned up during patching? [link to image](https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=5F2FF99137250CD8!6413&authkey=!AO4diFYqjYWZ2FM&v=3&ithint=photo%2cJPG)

replies.body:
Hey there,

As far as I can tell the latest packaged release of the installer doesn't come bundled with Pando Media Booster, are you sure you downloaded the latest release from [here](https://signup.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/download).

Regarding the temp files, I couldn't tell you what happened there. Did you allow the game to patch completely, or did you stop the patch mid-way through, possibly multiple times?

The current size for my League of Legends directory is **6.28 GB**.

i did let it download fully without stopping, i just re-checked now and it is at 5.19GB which sounds better, with this is am going to assume that the reboot removed the temp files, as when i finished downloading the game i launched it straight away and logged in and the temp files was still there.

with pando,i did download it from [here](https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=5F2FF99137250CD8!6414&authkey=!AMO_lvFAu14Ef1k&v=3&ithint=photo%2cJPG), maybe a isp or someone between me and riot has a old cached version, [here](https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=5F2FF99137250CD8!6415&authkey=!AAnZZSERm3cKees&v=3&ithint=photo%2cJPG) is my system restore points showing pando was installed
